iana.template_text:
Date: Wed, 20 Jan 1999 07:16:34 -0800 (PST)
From: Greg Vaudreuil <gregv&lucent.com>
To: iana&iana.org, gregv&lucent.com
Subject: Request for MIME media type Audio/Vendor Tree - vnd.vmx.cvsd

Name : Greg Vaudreuil

E-mail : gregv&lucent.com

MIME media type name : Audio

MIME subtype name : Vendor Tree - vnd.vmx.cvsd 

Required parameters : None

Optional parameters : 
None

Encoding considerations : 
This is  binary data.  Binary or Base-64 generally encoding is
preferred.

Security considerations : 
This media type consists of audio samples; it does not contain any
commands, control sequences, or any other material the misuse of which
could result in a security vulnerability.


Interoperability considerations : 
None

Published specification : 
None at this time

Applications which use this media : 
Primarily voice messaging including Lucent Technologies' Overture
200(TM), Overture 300(TM), VMX 200(TM), and VMX 300(TM) product lines.


Additional information :

1. Magic number(s) : N/A
2. File extension(s) : N/A
3. Macintosh file type code : N/A
This format is a fixed rate compressed audio format of 24 kbs used by
the VPIM implementations on several voice messaging products of the
Octel Messaging Division of Lucent Technologies.  The data is a binary
format with no header or trailer.  The compression algorithm is a
proprietary speech compression algorithm developed by the Octel
Messaging Division of Lucent Technologies.


Person to contact for further information :

1. Name : Jeff Bouis
2. E-mail : jbouis&lucent.com

Intended usage : Common 


Author/Change controller : Author/Change controller:

  Greg Vaudreuil or Jeff Bouis
